{"step_by_step_thinking": "The curve passing through the buccal and lingual cusp tips of the mandibular buccal teeth is a well-known concept in dentistry. The Wilson curve is a curve in the frontal plane, the Mansoon curve is not a recognized term in dentistry, and the Catenary curve is a mathematical term not typically used in dentistry. The Curve of Spee, however, is the curve of the mandibular arch that, when viewed from the side, shows the curve of the buccal cusp tips.", "answer_choice": "C. Curve of Spee"}
